DataElement.preferredDefinition: Unique sequential number assigned by a laboratory to the the fifth report for this case.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A specialty concerned with the nature and cause of disease as expressed by changes in cellular or tissue structure and function caused by the disease process. (MSH98)_A problem requiring investigation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Following the fourth position in an ordering or series; coming next after the fourth and just before the sixth in position._Report; a short account._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Following the fourth position in an ordering or series; coming next after the fourth and just before the sixth in position.:Report; a short account.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: Following the fourth position in an ordering or series; coming next after the fourth and just before the sixth in position.
A short textual account; having provided a short account.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR 12.1, Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 12.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (6/2010)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Path Report Number 5 Comment
ReferenceDocuments.description: This item accommodates only one path report. Information in this data item should refer to the path report described in data items 7014, 7104, 7194, and 7484.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Rationale
ReferenceDocuments.description: Describes the fifth pathology report contributing to this cancer abstract. The pathology report number provides a cross reference that identifies the specimen at the pathology facility. It may be useful for follow-back with the pathology facility.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR 16, Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 16 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (01/2016)

DataElement.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries
